body:
To implement this it would need some code to check to see if the leaf of the destination is the same as that found and to `Move` it if not

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/50cf97fc729ee305cb89260f2c7ed387cf12bac0/fs/sync/sync.go#L345

Might need to check all case insensitive file systems can actually rename `HELLO.txt` to `hello.txt`- this might need a new integration test.

issue.body:
### What is the purpose of this change?

Implement the `rclone bisync` command (port of [rclonesync](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2))

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Fixes #118

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-Q

### Action Items

- [x] Core functionality, first sync and dry run modes
- [x] Access health check
- [x] Filters file MD5 validation
- [x] Test engine for original test scenarios
- [x] Honor `--max-delete` flag
- [x] API endpoint `sync/bisync`
- [x] Basic test (`test_basic`) passes
- [x] Draft documentation
- [x] Really compare console logs
- [x] Make first-sync and dry-run tests pass
- [x] Implement ABORT/CRITICAL logic
- [x] Compatibility with `--legacy` messages and tests
- [x] Port README.md and TESTING.md
- [x] All tests pass on Local FS
- [x] All tests pass with Google Drive
- [x] All tests pass with Dropbox
- [x] Tests run and pass on Windows
- [x] Fix tests for Mailru
- [x] Fix tests for FTP (depends on #5283)
- [x] Fix tests for SFTP
- [x] Fix tests for AWS S3
- [x] Fix tests for Chunker/LocalFs (depends on #5297)
- [x] Put verbosity of bisync messages under control
- [x] Develop legacy free syntax for test scenarios
- [x] Keep hash in listings, if available (don't use for sync yet). See [rclonesync#5](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/5)
- [x] Parallelize all list/copy/delete operations for performance
- [x] Drop legacy support as soon as we are fully decoupled from the original project
- [x] Gracefully handle invalid UTF-8 in filenames. ([rcsync#62](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/62))
- [x] Handle files that change during a bisync run - _documented_ ([rcsync#24](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/24))
- [x] Fix remaining FIXMEs
- [x] Add original license, author and attributions
- [x] More docs: FILTERING.md, USAGE.md, TROUBLESHOOTING.md
- [x] Inventory bug reports from the original project

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
### Intro

The bisync pull request #5164 appeared too large to fulfil in a single rclone release.

Plan is to merge it right after the rclone v1.57 release. The command will be available in the beta builds for a limited circle of beta testers until official release with rclone v1.58.
During the beta period we can merge a number of postponed items, **in particular breaking changes**.

This ticket will keep track of the most beta time changes. Large and critical changes will be split into separate tickets.
High priority items reflect changes breaking user experience and must be completed before 1.58. Medium priority items are required but not guaranteed by 1.58. Optional and low priority items will be implemented on best effort basis. Optional items don't even have dedicated tickets yet.

### High priority

- [ ] Track critical flags in saved sessions - #5678
- [ ] Support imprecise or absent modtimes - #5679
- [ ] Use hashsums, honor `--checksum` - #5683

### Medium priority

- [ ] Check file sizes - #5684
- [ ] Respect `--backup-dir` - #5685
- [ ] Align `--max-delete` semantics - #5680
- [ ] Optimize resync - #5681
- [ ] Track renames - #5690

### Low priority

- [ ] Handle deletion conflicts - #5691
- [ ] Honor `--interactive` and `--auto-confirm`
- [ ] Recover after transient failures - #5676
- [ ] Use **trie** for listings to reduce footprint - #5686
- [ ] Maintain session history - #5692
- [ ] Handle Google Docs better - #5696

### Optional items

- [ ] Parallelize move/rename operations
- [ ] Honor special `.rcignore` files
- [ ] Revisit progress display for bisync
- [ ] Handle case-insensitive filenames. Respect `--ignore-case` and `--ignore-case-sync` ([rcsync#54](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/54), [#4854](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4854))
- [ ] Synchronize empty dirs if supported by backend ([rcsync#63](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/63))
- [ ] Fix tests for Google Photos ([rcsync#53](https://github.com/cjnaz/rclonesync-V2/issues/53), [G.Photos issues](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Remote%3A+Google+Photos%22))
- [ ] Enable CI tests with OwnCloud (according to @cjnaz it's stable)
- [ ] Test should handle Dropbox "touch quirks" in a generic way

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the üëç [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.

issue.title: Ability to ignore case on Dedupe

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
I am syncing photos from GDrive to S3. I first run a dedupe (with rename) on GDrive as S3 doesn't allow duplicate file names.

But dedupe will consider DSCNxxx.JPG and DSCNxxx.jpg to be different files and ignore them, when I sync to S3 I get

"Warning: File found with same name but different case on S3 bucket"

It would be nice if dedupe had the option to ignore case and still rename files, resulting in

DSCNxxx-1.jpg
DSCNxxx-2.JPG

issue.title: [Feature Request] Add option --case-insensitive to rclone dedupe

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

Hi!

We understand you are having a problem with rclone or have an idea for an improvement - we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue.  We'll reply quickly and it won't increase our massive issue backlog.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    
If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

If you have an idea for an improvement, then please search the old issues first and if you don't find your idea, make a new issue.

Thanks

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
rclone dedupe does not merge folders when case in any one of the characters differs. Example:

The following folders are merged:
`This is My Folder 1`
`This is My Folder 1`

But the following are not:
`This is My Folder 2`
`this is My Folder 2`

#### What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
```
rclone v1.42
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.10.1
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Linux 64 bit
Mac OS 12.6 64 bit

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google drive

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone dedupe

body:
The new flag should work in `copy`, `sync` and `dedupe`
- #1133
- #2430

This would be a good addition, but I think the original post mixed up the priority: the destination name should be changed to match the case of the source name, not the other way around. (The source filename should be the source-of-truth.)

Even though `FILE.txt` and `file.txt` are the same file on macOS, rclone should preserve the casing during syncs-otherwise, we're not really "cloning" the file because information is lost. That loss might seem trivial, but it's still a loss.

I also have updated a bunch of files and folder cases. (I have capitalized a lot of stuff)
It would be great if rclone could fix the cases on the destination as well.
This addition would be useful. Any updates on this?

> This addition would be useful. Any updates on this?

Yes -- I've opened a PR üôÇ https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/7356

issue.title: bisync: logger, march, and several big bug fixes

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

A suite of several related fixes tackling bisync's biggest pain points.

Highlights:
- bisync: merge copies and deletes, support `--track-renames` and `--backup-dir` -- fixes #5690 and #5685
- operations: add logger to log list of sync results -- fixes #7282
- sync: report list of synced paths to file -- see #7282
- bisync: generate final listing from sync results, not relisting - fixes #5676
- bisync: rollback listing on sync error
- bisync: generate listings concurrently with march -- fixes #7332
- sync: `--fix-case` flag to rename case insensitive dest -- fixes #4854
- bisync: handle unicode and case normalization consistently - fixes #7270
- bisync: optimize `--resync` performance -- partially addresses #5681
- bisync: add support for Google Docs - fixes #5696

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Yes. See [this post](https://forum.rclone.org/t/bisync-bugs-and-feature-requests/37636) and the individual issues linked above.

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)
